member.name: P:WindowsApplication1.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:WindowsApplication1.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:WindowsApplication1.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.IsConnected
member.summary: Indicates if this instance is currently connected to a device.

member.name: P:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.IsRunning
member.summary: Indicates if the capture graph is running or paused/stoped.

member.name: T:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.FrameSizes
member.summary: Enum of common video frame sizes. Used to set the (frameSize) parameter of the (ConnectToDevice) function.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.ConnectToDevice(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Size,WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.FrameSizes,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Connects this instance of the Capture class to the specified capture device index.
member.param: The Zero Based Index Of Capture Device To Connect To.
The Capture Rate. Equivilant to FPS.
The size of the visible video window.
The size used for the video frames. This will also be the size images are saved as.
A Handle To The Parent Window.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.ResizeWindow(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to resize and/or change the location of the visible video window.
member.param: The new Width of the window.
The new Height of the window.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.GetCaptureDevices
member.summary: Returns a string array containing all video capture device names in the device index order that are currently available.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the capture graph. Running the graph takes up a lot of resources. (Pause) it when it isn't needed at the time and (Start) it when needed again.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.SaveCurrentFrame(System.String,System.Drawing.Imaging.ImageFormat)
member.summary: Saves an image file of the current video frame and passes the captured image to the (capImage) parameter in the (FrameSaved) event.
member.param: The full path, name, and extension to save the image as.
The image format for saving the file. Make sure the file extension matches.

member.name: M:WindowsApplication1.DSCamCapture.GetCurrentFrame
member.summary: Gets the current video frame and passes the captured image as the (capImage) parameter in the (FrameCaptured) event.
